summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from April 2019 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff regarding travel arrangements for prosecutors to West Palm Beach, Florida, for the case United States v. Epstein. The emails detail flight bookings, hotel reservations, and conference room arrangements for meetings with witnesses.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.role: Legal Assistant, Public Corruption, U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY)
persons.context: She is the travel arranger and legal assistant coordinating flight, hotel, and conference room bookings for the prosecutors traveling to Florida for the Epstein case.

persons.name: Alex
persons.role: Assistant U.S. Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: He is a prosecutor traveling to West Palm Beach for the Epstein case, requesting travel bookings and arranging witness meetings.

persons.name: Alison
persons.role: Assistant U.S. Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: She is a prosecutor traveling with Alex to Florida for the Epstein case; Darlene Alleyne requests to be set as her travel arranger in the E2 system.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: She informs the team about travel procedures, including links for lodging rates and tax exemptions, and provides guidelines for booking travel in the E2 system.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: He approves travel requests for the prosecutors to travel to Florida for the Epstein case investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He is the defendant in the case United States v. Epstein, which involves an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.

connections.description: They are both Assistant U.S. Attorneys traveling together to Florida for meetings and interviews related to the Epstein case.
Darlene Alleyne, as a legal assistant, assists Alex with booking flights, hotels, and conference rooms for his travel to Florida.
Darlene Alleyne requests to be set as Alison's travel arranger in the E2 system to make reservations on her behalf.
Edward Tyrrell approves travel requests submitted by Alex for the Epstein case investigation.
Michele Duncan informs Darlene Alleyne about the travel to Florida and provides travel procedure guidelines.

events.title: Travel to West Palm Beach for Witness Meetings
events.description: Prosecutors Alex and Alison travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and interviews with witnesses in the Epstein case. They book a conference room at the Hyatt Place for these meetings.

events.title: Travel Approval Request for Epstein Case
events.description: Alex requests permission from Edward Tyrrell to travel to Florida for approximately three days for meetings and interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Initial Travel Approval Request
events.description: Alex and an unnamed colleague request permission to travel to West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale for two days of meetings and interviews for the Epstein case.

locations: Hyatt Place West Palm Beach Downtown
keyFacts: The document reveals active investigation and witness interviews by the SDNY in the Epstein case (United States v. Epstein) as of April 2019, specifically for enticement of minors for sexual activity.
Prosecutors were traveling to West Palm Beach, Florida, to conduct meetings with witnesses, indicating the geographic scope of the investigation.
The emails show detailed coordination for official travel, including flight bookings, hotel reservations, and conference room arrangements for witness interviews.
The case is referenced with docket number 2018R01618, confirming it was an ongoing federal prosecution.
The correspondence highlights the internal bureaucratic process within the U.S. Attorney's Office for approving and arranging official travel for case-related work.
